titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Snow fell during the night so that there was a "white Christmas" after all. I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Chapel at 8 a.m. We numbered 19 altogether, including the 3 Bryden boys & Horrie. We motored to South Church, and there I preached at Mattins, & afterwards celebrated the Holy Communion. There were about 60 communicants, among whom were Kenneth, and his mother.

We motored to Durham, & attended Evensong in the Cathedral. I occupied the Throne, & pronounced the Benediction after 3 carols had been admirably sung by the Choir. Then I gave Christmas Boxes to the five vergers, the senior sub–verger. an almsman, the porter, the park–keeper, & the girl at the White Gate. This cost me £9. We had tea with the Bishop of Jarrow, and returned to Auckland.
